title: A Car Collector’s Dream Home in Quebec
text:
Listing of the Day

Location: Lennoxville (Sherbrooke), Quebec, Canada

Price: C$2.5 million (US$1.89 million)

Calling all car collectors—this 15,000-square-foot contemporary in the Eastern Townships of Quebec offers garage space for 27 cars.

"The owner is a car collector with a great collection of exotic cars," listing agent David O’Malley said. "He built an 18-car gallery for his precious cars."

Along with the one giant garage, there are three smaller garages that can hold another nine cars, he said.

The Eastern Townships region "is an area loved by a lot of Europeans and an international market," Mr. O’Malley said.

More: Nearly 400-Acre Canadian Estate in Rugged Wilderness to Be Auctioned

The area is also popular with second-home owners from Montreal, which is about 90 minutes away, he said.

Construction on the cedar and stone house began in 2010 and took about two years, he added. "It sits on a cul de sac and is very private."

Architectural and design features include 4,000 square feet of marble, a double-sided fireplace, a 700-pound solid stainless-steel entry door from Neoporte, a spiral steel staircase leading to a rooftop patio, automated indoor/outdoor lighting, smart home systems and in-wall speakers by Paradigm.

Some of the rooms have tall walls of oversized windows that bring in lots of natural light. The large and high-end kitchen is mostly in shades of gray and white, with splashes of black and bright red to add pop.

Stats

The 15,000-square-foot house has four bedrooms, four full bathrooms and two partial bathrooms. It sits on a 4.1-acre lot.

Amenities

The house has a fully equipped spa with a 16-by-32-foot indoor swimming pool, a sauna and a large shower.

Neighborhood Notes

The house is located very near Bishop’s University and Bishop’s College School, a "boarding school attended by kids from around the world," Mr. O’Malley said.

There are also lots of good shops and restaurants nearby, he said.
